Authors:
Jan Sevcik, David Kasprak, Michal Mantic, Tereza Sevcikova,
Andrea Tothova
Title:
Molecular phylogeny of the fungus gnat family Diadocidiidae
and its position within the infraorder Bibionomorpha (Diptera)
Keywords:
Sciaroidea, phylogenetic analysis, molecular markers,
systematics
Abstract:
Molecular phylogeny of the family Diadocidiidae (Diptera:
Sciaroidea) is reconstructed based on the combined analysis of four
mitochondrial (12S, 16S, COI, cytB) and two nuclear (28S, ITS2) gene
markers. All the analyses strongly support Diadocidiidae as a
monophyletic group. Genus Diadocidia Ruthe, 1831 includes monophyletic
subgenera Diadocidia s. str. and Taidocidia Papp & Å evÄÃ­k, 2005.
The monophyly of Adidocidia LaÅ¡tovka & Matile, 1972 was not
confirmed. The position of Diadocidiidae and relationships of the
families within the infraorder Bibionomorpha is demonstrated in the
analyses based on three gene markers (28S, 12S and 16S). The Bayesian
and maximum likelihood analyses of 12 families of Bibionomorpha revealed
Sciaridae as the closest relative of Diadocidiidae. Most of the
currently recognized extant families of Bibionomorpha proved to be
monophyletic. The family Keroplatidae revealed as paraphyletic, with the
genera of Macrocerinae being more related to Cecidomyiidae.
